text: Take your flocks, too, and your herds, as you said, and go; and bless me, too!”

Jeroboam established a feast in the eighth month on the fifteenth day of the month like the pilgrimage feast in Judah, and he went up to the altar. He did this in Bethel, sacrificing to the calves he had made. He stationed in Bethel the priests of the high places he had built.
Of the half-tribe of Manasseh: eighteen thousand, designated by name to come and make David king.
followed by Hoshaiah and half the administrators of Judah,
Then he broke camp, marched on toward Damascus and traveled through the whole region.
After this feast, also called Pentecost, they lost no time in marching against Gorgias, governor of Idumea,
And whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven; but whoever speaks against the holy Spirit will not be forgiven, either in this age or in the age to come.
The scribe said to him, “Well said, teacher. You are right in saying, ‘He is One and there is no other than he.’
Do not be afraid any longer, little flock, for your Father is pleased to give you the kingdom.
And when I am lifted up from the earth, I will draw everyone to myself.”
